PIie2p79rOWTj5Hz9gVZEw.text: There were 2 floors for this outlet. Tables were placed quite close to each other. Sitting at the first floor could be quite noisy from the children's noise to the cooking at the kitchen.Steam Dumpling in Two Ways 鸳鸯蒸饺子  (S$6.30++/ 3pcs)Shrimp, pork, mushroom, salted egg yolkColorful presented. Tasted not bad. Wished that the skin could be thinner.Steamed Salted Egg Yolk Xiao Long Bao 咸蛋黄小笼包 (S$8.30++/ 4pcs)Could taste the rich salted egg yolk easily. There was no need to dip the dumplings in vinegar.La Main with Braised Beef Brisket 牛腩汤拉面 (S$12.80++)The broth was flavourful and the noodles was smooth and silky, plus the meat was tender.

photos.caption: Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore

kOrIvy1dpp4wiB4oz4pfdA.text: Quite a large space upstairs. Dim sum is pretty good here, but noodles can sometimes be drenched in ma la sauce. Pretty good and prompt service, reasonable pricing. Just about average.

ybelBpQYyHUBRpIcVIHRSw.text: There are 2 floors in this restaurant. The bottom floor serves ramen and dumplings for dinner, white the upstairs serves hotpot and dumplings for dinner. There are 3 seating times for the hotpot, so be sure to go early.I've never tried the hotpot here (YET) so can't comment on it, but I have eaten downstairs many times for dinner. The ramen is good, I had the spicy ramen and it was pretty spicy. Also, tried different types of xiaolong baos- the cheese mushroom one was ok. I still like the original My friend tried the salted egg and chili crab xiao long baos.You can't go wrong with Crystal Jade- the food is good. There is also a bakery next door so you can bring home egg tarts and pastries!

photos.caption: Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore. Spicy fish ramen
Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore. Xiao long bao. Yellow is cheese and mushroom. Orange is salted yolk. Pink is chili crab. Light brown is original.

M7UIjF9XMWqshGkyt-fPBg.text: The food is very tasty, but seems to be MSG-laden (unfortunate for my sensitive stomach. Also the case for most casual Chinese restaurants). I've only visited the first floor - we ordered noodles and xiao long bao (dumplings) to share. Portions are a good size for the price, and dishes are hearty. Can't go wrong with any orders here at Crystal Jade! Downside: Usually very packed at peak hours, and difficult to make a reservation ahead of time; for some reason their line is always on hold... Expect a wait for dinner, so get there early by 6pm or after 8pm for a more pleasant waiting/dining experience.

AU3Ah1DcyCKyM_HVqzTTxw.text: It's so good! The service was excellent. The soup base, the xiao long bao, the steamboat ingredients were awesome! We love it and enjoyed it very much! Would definitely come back again! =)

sNcXMbAFmuFYhTqOn5fzMg.text: I'm surprised there aren't better reviews for this! This is the first place I come to every time I'm back from studying abroad, for the unlimited xiao long bao & hot pot a la carte buffet (~$25 after tax). It's literally a no brainer because those are 2 of my favorite foods!! The hotpot is so good here. The soup in hotpot is crucial to me, if not its kind of no point eating all that food, and crystal jade has great fragrant soups. I always order a ma la & a pork bones soup with corn. The ma la is solid, without too much chili oil and retaining the flavor of the soup underneath. It's also not too heavy that I can drink it at the end (or maybe that's just me). The non spicy options are diverse and impressive, not like the generic tasteless chicken soup options at many hotpot places. I love drinking the non spicy soup too. The menu involved tons of ingredients - meats, prawns, great dumplings, la mian, lots of veggies, and so on. They also have small deserts like red bean & osmanthus jelly. The xlbs are lovely, with thin skin that's easily pierced. I always feel so ambitious eating it but after sharing 3 orders I feel a bit stuffed.Docking 1 star only because of how difficult it is to make a reservation. They do hotpot in time slots of about 1.5 hours each only for dinner, and you basically need a reservation to get in. But they don't pick up their phones and I often have to keep trying for 3-4 times...I still do it though!

8QtDRTFN7tK8nsjYe4yAjQ.text: This place had a seat open last night for my friends and I and this did not disappoint. I wish I had a bigger belly to have tried more dishes! Everything we got was not a matter of what was good, but what was best only because everything was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore. Wish I ordered more dim sum.. Sooo good!
Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore. Dan Dan spicy peanut noodle bowl was the best I have ever had

tQ5cknRq4MK9Mfu7aQCMyg.text: Tried calling for an entire day (20+ times at the numbers provided by your staff) and couldn't get through booking for the steamboat buffet.This is beyond frustrating. I hope something can be done about it.

qjpoH2WUNmgWF-jAf6TCgw.text: Service can be spotty at times, and this outlet in particular has issues with the consistency of their food.That said, it's quick and convenient - I love their dumplings in chili oil and the onion oil la mian.

c4N9_qR0GGlhW_aaECCA6Q.text: Crystal Jade is my to-go when I happen to be craving chinese food while at holland village. There is almost always a queue, and it gets especially crowded during lunch and dinner times even though I've never had to wait for more than half an hour.The food is decent- the xiaolongbao is consistently satisfactory, though it is nothing like Ding Tai Fung's 19-fold xiaolongbaos. They've recently also made each xiaolongbao bigger and downsized the 'long's to only containing 4 xiaolongbaos per portion, which is a good thing if you're sharing between two people. I also like their minced meat mixed sauce noodle (zha jiang mian), the sauce is sufficiently complex without leaving you too jelat. Service is fantastic even during peak hours. It is amazing how attentive the staff are. They mostly speak mandarin with a mixture of cantonese, but will have no problem understanding and taking orders in English.My favourite part has to be the vibe of the entire restaurant. It is super unpretentious- the waitstaff are all dressed nicely in uniforms, but you never feel out of place even if you wear flip flops (I cant say the same if I were to go Yan Ting for example). It is air-conditioned and always bustling as a restaurant should, but without the hastiness of HK tea houses.

photos.caption: Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore

oA9tjWTT60YhVSnRM2Y_Yg.text: Love steamboat and Xiao Long Bao (XLB)? This place has steamboat buffet with free flow xiao long bao. Great for late night supper as their last sitting is from 10 - 12 mn.XLB is good but not the best. But well, no complaints since its free flow. In fact, after a while, you just get OD on XLB. As for the steamboat, you get to choose between pork bone or ma la. The broth is tasty and the typical ingredients we find in a steamboat. Prawns are not free flow tho.The only problem is its very difficult to make a reservation.  Often, tried calling many times and no one pick up the calls.This crystal jade has two storey. Upstairs host the hungry diners for steamboat. If you are not in the mood for steamboat, you can order ala carte dishes downstairs.

O0e9iXwiDIYg9VGGs9smIQ.text: I went in as a single diner on a reasonably busy Saturday night, and got lucky and was seated immediately.  The first question I was asked, was, "Al La Carte" - presumably there is a fixed-price dinner, that I did not have.  Service was fast, and they took my order quickly (it was a fill in the sheet type order form) - I had the Cold Chicken Marin, Sauteed French Beans, Steamed Pork Dumplings, and Glutenous Dumplings for dessert. It was all pretty ok, thought the Dumplings weren't anything to write home about - Paradise Dynasty is leaps and bounds better at a lower cost.For an average sized dinner, in a coffee shop environment, The price at $44.50 was a little steep - I probably wouldn't come back for an Al La carte dinner - reading the reviews, it looks like there is better value to be had here in the fixed price deals.

Yu2y4ChmUn3LzTQmVBFPaw.text: They have a lunch deal which is great value.  You can get a full set of xia long baos, noodles, and a drink for $10 nett.  Considering xia long baos are $6 , this is a great deal.  Also, we went at noon time and there were plenty of tables and no wait.

T_DMBVCOOMkwM_BY19w1dg.text: Crystal Jade is always a crowd pleaser when it comes to Chinese food. The Xiao Long Bao restaurant in Holland Village is always crowded so expect to wait a while if you are coming during the peak hours. Service is always very fast and efficient. Dumplings are great here, even the vegetarian ones. You can order lots of small dishes here, like scallion pancakes as well as various noodle dishes. I come back here a lot and always leave satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore
Photo of Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao - Singapore, Singapore

nmzZJy91P8uFmNxZJM_iUg.text: I had a family brunch at Crystal Jade Xiao Long Bao today and was delighted by the good service and food. My grandmother is wheelchair bound which made choosing meal locations trickier, as the restaurant had to have a street entrance with a ramp of sorts. This branch of Crystal Jade fit the criteria so I suggested we came here for brunch today. We were given a table in the bottom level of the restaurant, but the entrance of the restaurant was rather cramped. While I was worrying about how the wheelchair was going to maneuver around the tight bend, a waitress surprised me by pushing open one of the glass panels in the middle of the restaurant to allow easier access for my grandmother. So cool! On to the food. The good dishes: Chao Shou (dumplings in spicy sauce), Spring Onion Noodles and Chong You Bing (scallion pancakes). The mediocre dishes: Xiao Long Bao and Fried Rice with Egg White and Fish. You'll be able to find better XLBs at Ding Tai Feng. On the whole, I enjoyed my meal here and I'll be back to try the other soupy la mian options!

rE1m0bHob3VrecDtqs6yUw.text: Crystal Jade on Holland Avenue was filmed in a James Bond movie.  Was it?  Laksa noodles from a hawker stall and a last minute Hainan chicken cab run, Singapore is a foodies' paradise.

2JskfnNGg6JwFTRpLpbiAA.text: Quick service and great xiao long bao!

LHNl7u71RayPeMwF_y-0fg.text: Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao like all the other Crystal Jade restaurants, does the job of satisfying an empty stomach with decent food. The restaurant is spread over 2 stories, with the 2nd floor being used for a steamboat buffet at night. The restaurant serves the usual la mian, and xiao long baos. It's a place I used to come to, back in the JC days, when i felt like eating a yummy bowl of noodles but didn't feel like sweating it out in the hawker centre. My favourite thing to order here is the spring onion oil noodles - though I hesitate to call the noodles the restaurant's specialty - the dish is pretty much served the same way throughout all the Crystal Jade La Mian Xiao Long Bao restaurants.
